info.author: Nick Lewis thecanary@gmail.com
info.abstract:
Difficulty, Ability, and Study History (DASH): Four models that add time or memory strength to a logistic regression over the "error rate" learning curve data.
The Memory Model option defaults to "Last Retention Time" (LRT) but also supports variations on the underlying cognitive model: DASH, DASH-MCM and DASH-ACTR. DASH-MCM stands for "Multiscale Context Model" and DASH-ACTR is "Adaptive Control of Thought-Rational". The LRT model simply adds time between opportunities as a factor.
DASH models are taken from Michael Mozer and Robert Lindsey's work incorporating cognitive theories into big data approaches.
The Factor Type option specifies whether to use the memory factor as either a fixed effect or as a random slope on items (KCs).
info.options:
KC Model - the column containing the Knowledge Component Model (KCM) data
Memory Model - Choose between the type of memory model that generates the memory factor
Factor Type - Choose between setting memory as a fixed effect or as a random slope on item (KC)
